result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kassandra J. Declark

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kassandra J. Declark in court with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15FO371, 15CM73, 15CM175, 15CM186, 15CM192, 15CM203, 15CM208 and 16CM128.  Cased called at 9:08 am.  Agreement reached.  15CM73 Move to dismiss and read in.  15CM175 Move to dismiss and read in.  15CM192 Dismiss out right.  15CM208  Move to dismiss and read in.  Additional referrals.   15CM186  Def to enter plea to Ct 1, 2 & 3.  Ct 4 to be dismissed and read in.  Jail 40 days, credit of 30 days, sentence completed.  Cost to be assessed.  15CM203  Def to plea to Ct 1, Ct 2, 3, 4, & 5 dismiss and read in.  Probation with conditions.  16CM128 Victim rights have been complied with.  Plea Ct 1, Ct 2& 3 to be dismiss and read in.  Probation.  15FO371 County citation, move to dismiss.  Counsel and def agree with the plea agreement as stated.  Plea questionnaire completed.  Court reviews this form with def.  15CM186 Ct 1 DC - Guilty plea  Ct 2 Guilty plea  Ct 3 Guilty plea   15CM203 Ct 1 - Guilty plea.  16CM128 Ct 1 - No contest plea.  Court grants motion   15FO371 Dismissed  15CM73 Dismissed and read in  15CM175 Dismissed and read in  15CM186 Ct 4 dismissed and read in  15CM192  Dismissed and read in   15CM203 Ct 2,3,4,& 5 dismissed and read in. 15CM208 Dismissed and read in.  16CM128 Ct 2 & 3 dismissed and read in.  Constitutional rights and right to jury trial reviewed.  Elements & penalties reviewed.  Court finds def has entered pleas freely & voluntarily.  Court finds def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Factual basis.  Pleas accepted and found guilty, 15CM183 Ct 1,2 &3.  15CM203 Ct 1  and 16CM128 Ct 1.  Sentencing arguments presented by State.  Atty Seifert presents sentencing arguments.  Statement by def.  Sentencing remarks by Court.  City citation OAS, Court will dismiss without prejudice, 16TR25.  Court 15CM186 Ct 1 40 days jail, cr 30 days.  Court cost & DNA surcharge  Ct 2 40 days jail concurrent, Cr 30 days   Court cost & DNA surcharge  Ct 3 40 days jail, cr 30 days.  Concurrent.  Cost & DNA surcharge and DNA sample.    15CM203  Ct 1 Sentence withheld, probation 1 year Counseling as deemed necessary, AODA assessment and follow through  Court cost & DNA surcharge.  16CM128  Sentence withheld 2 yrs probation  Cost & DNA surcharge.  Counseling as deemed and AODA.  No contact with Kristopher Jackson.  Restitution held open for 60 days, subject to hearing.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Post conviction rights.  15CM186 payment plan for cost.  Court notes referrals for sentencing.  Verified all counts dismissed and read in. State indicates 15CM192 should be dismissed out right  Court will dismiss 15CM92

Status conference on May 9, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Kassandra J. Declark in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CM203, 15CM192, 15CM208, 15CM73, 15CM175, 15CM186, 15FO371 & 16TR25  @ 9:17am.  Atty Laufenberg has received offer, Defendant does not agree with offer.  Defendant was at Mental Inst. and couldn't talk over issues with Atty.  J.T. will be on 15CM203. Def. must attend FPT. Court adjourns @ 9:24am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Atty Laufenberg receives criminal complaints on all files that have not appeared on,  waives reading, reserve rights & enters Not Guilty plea to all cases that don't have pleas.   Court receives not guilty to all files that have not had initial appearance on them.  Status conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
